perturbation.original_text:
a) “CONTRACT PERIOD” means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and 
terminating on May 31, 2016 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
a) “CONTRACT PERIOD” means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and 
terminating on May 31, 2016. Berkshire retains the right to extend the Contract Period on an annual basis, subject to Auriemma's continued availability and mutual agreement; however, Berkshire's decision is final.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a clear termination date. The modified text introduces uncertainty by suggesting a possible extension at Berkshire's discretion, creating a contradiction about the definite duration of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Past due cash payments (i.e., payments due more than thirty (30) days after Berkshire’s receipt of the 
applicable invoice) shall bear interest at the rate of one (1%) percent per month.
perturbation.changed_text:
Past due cash payments (i.e., payments due more than thirty (30) days after Berkshire’s receipt of the 
applicable invoice) may bear interest at a rate determined solely at Berkshire's discretion, not exceeding one (1%) percent per month.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a specific interest rate on late payments. The modified text makes the interest rate discretionary, thus creating uncertainty and contradicting the original obligation.

perturbation.original_text:
Berkshire may terminate this Agreement immediately by giving Auriemma notice if (i) Auriemma dies or is prevented by injury or illness from 
satisfactorily performing the obligations required by this Agreement; (ii) Auriemma is convicted of a felony or criminal offense involving 
dishonesty or fraud; or (iii) Auriemma publicly disparages Berkshire and/ or its products.
perturbation.changed_text:
Berkshire may terminate this Agreement, subject to Auriemma's right of first refusal to cure, by giving Auriemma notice if (i) Auriemma dies or is prevented by injury or illness from 
satisfactorily performing the obligations required by this Agreement; (ii) Auriemma is convicted of a felony or criminal offense involving 
dishonesty or fraud; or (iii) Auriemma publicly disparages Berkshire and/ or its products. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Berkshire's decision on whether to terminate is final.
perturbation.explanation: While the original text provides clear conditions for Berkshire's termination rights, this is now contradicted by providing Auriemma a right of first refusal. The added sentence that Berkshire's decision on whether to terminate is final creates more contradiction and ambiguity on the termination process.
